uk.co.strangeskies.reflection

Class TypeSubstitution

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.strangeskies.reflection.TypeSubstitution

  • public class TypeSubstitution
extends java.lang.Object
    A TypeSubstitution object is a function mapping Type to Type, which recursively visits each type mentioned by a given type and applies a substitution to those it encounters which match a given condition.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TypeSubstitution()
      Create a new TypeSubstitution with no initial substitution rules.
      TypeSubstitution(java.util.function.Function<? super java.lang.reflect.Type,? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> mapping)
      Create a new TypeSubstitution to apply the given mapping function.
      TypeSubstitution(java.util.Map<?,? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> mapping)
      Create a new TypeSubstitution to apply the given mapping.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TypeSubstitution

        public TypeSubstitution()
        Create a new TypeSubstitution with no initial substitution rules.

      • TypeSubstitution

        public TypeSubstitution(java.util.function.Function<? super java.lang.reflect.Type,? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> mapping)
        Create a new TypeSubstitution to apply the given mapping function. Typically we do something like create an instance from a Map of Type instances to other Type instances, then pass the method reference of Map.get(Object) for that map to this constructor. For this specific example use case though, TypeSubstitution(Map) would perform slightly better.
        Parameters:
        mapping - A mapping function for transforming encountered types to their substitution types.

      • TypeSubstitution

        public TypeSubstitution(java.util.Map<?,? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> mapping)
        Create a new TypeSubstitution to apply the given mapping. This is more efficient than the more general TypeSubstitution(Function) constructor, as it can skip type traversal for empty maps.
        Parameters:
        mapping - A mapping function for transforming encountered types to their substitution types.

    • Method Detail

      • where

        public TypeSubstitution where(java.lang.reflect.Type from,
                              java.lang.reflect.Type to)
        Create a new TypeSubstitution by adding a specific single substitution rule to the receiver of the invocation. The new rule will be checked and applied before any existing rules. The receiving TypeSubstitution of invocation of this method will remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        from - The type to match in application of this rule.
        to - The type to substitute for types which match the rule.
        Returns:
        A new TypeSubstitution object with the rule added.

      • where

        public TypeSubstitution where(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Type> from,
                              java.util.function.Function<java.lang.reflect.Type,java.lang.reflect.Type> to)
        Create a new TypeSubstitution by adding a specific single substitution rule to the receiver of the invocation. The new rule will be checked and applied before any existing rules. The receiving TypeSubstitution of invocation of this method will remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        from - The type matching condition of the new rule.
        to - The substitution transformation to apply to types matching the given condition.
        Returns:
        A new TypeSubstitution object with the rule added.

      • resolve

        public java.lang.reflect.Type resolve(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
        Resolve the result of this substitution as applied to the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type for which we want to make a substitution.
        Returns:
        The result of application of this substitution. The result is not guaranteed to be well formed with respect to bounds.
